vague_description: A farmer needs to determine the optimal allocation of his resources (land, watering time, and pesticide budget) to maximize profit from growing turnips and pumpkins.
detailed_description: A farmer has \var{TotalAcres} acres of land to grow turnips and pumpkins. Turnips require \var{WateringTurnips} minutes of watering and $\var{PesticideTurnips} worth of pesticide per acre. Pumpkins require \var{WateringPumpkins} minutes of watering and $\var{PesticidePumpkins} worth of pesticide per acre. The farmer has \var{TotalWateringTime} minutes available for watering and $\var{TotalPesticideBudget} available to spend on pesticide. If the revenue per acre of turnips is $\var{RevenueTurnips} and the revenue per acre of pumpkins is $\var{RevenuePumpkins}, how many acres of each should he grow to maximize his revenue.
target_objective: Maximize the revenue from turnips (RevenueTurnips * acres of turnips) plus revenue from pumpkins (RevenuePumpkins * acres of pumpkins)
target_constraints: Acres of turnips plus acres of pumpkins must be less than or equal to TotalAcres
Watering time for turnips plus watering time for pumpkins must be less than or equal to TotalWateringTime
Pesticide cost for turnips plus pesticide cost for pumpkins must be less than or equal to TotalPesticideBudget
target_parameters: Total acres of land available for growing turnips and pumpkins
Time required for watering per acre of turnips
Pesticide cost per acre of turnips
Time required for watering per acre of pumpkins
Pesticide cost per acre of pumpkins
